medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has been experiencing chronic bilateral lower quadrant abdominal pain for months. Over the last 3 days, she reports worsened left lower quadrant pain that is sharp, constant, and unaffected by food. She also has intermittent loose stools (non-bloody) with occasional constipation. Mild intermittent nausea has been noted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic graft versus host disease manifesting as joint aches and increased liver transaminases; pulmonary embolus; recurrent DVT; sacral insufficiency fracture; L5 compression fracture; multiple disc herniations; past history of herpes zoster; latent TB with past treatment; gastric ulcers.
